rename.to: how can i get the correspondence index?

body: I was expecting to get pairs of points {(q_r, q_t)}

Hi @caijinana,
I do not understand your question. Can you clarify which part of the code you are referring to and what you are trying to achieve?
Best regards

Hi@ThibaultGROUEIX,i want to say how to get the correspondence point {(qr,qt)}where qr is a point on the source model and qt is   a point on the target model, i want to get a random point and it's correspindence point. i test on difference dataset but all get terrible result. i found it worked good only test on Faust_dataset. How could i solve the problem?
I use the following code to get the correspondence:
`            if self.project_on_target:
                print("projection on target...")
                self.neigh.fit(target.vertices)
                idx_knn = self.neigh.kneighbors(closest_points, return_distance=False)
                closest_points = target.vertices[idx_knn]
                np.savetxt("results/correspondences_tar.txt", idx_knn, fmt='%d')
                closest_points = np.mean(closest_points, 1, keepdims=False)
     with open("correspondences_tar.txt") as f:
    cpt = 0
    for line in f:
        cpt += 1
        if cpt == 3377 or cpt==4432 or cpt==5566or cpt==5524or cpt==5404or cpt==5411 or cpt==3519 or cpt==5520 or cpt==5492 or cpt==4403 or cpt==6138 or cpt==7168 or cpt==6122 or cpt==8244\
            or cpt==8244 or cpt==8138 or cpt==8145 or cpt==6280 or cpt==8239 or cpt==8221 or cpt==7139:
            result=(cpt,int(line))
            print(result)`

Hi @caijinana ,

The model should be robust across datasets. Can share a meshlab plot of a sample of your new dataset overlayed with one of Faust meshes?

things to look for :
- orientation of your new data
- scale of your new data

Best regards;
Thibault

i used smplx model as input A ,another smplx model as input b,but get terrible rusult.

Can you share a meshlab plot of a sample of your new dataset overlayed with one of Faust meshes?

I think that your orientation is likely wrong. The simple way to check this is to open jointly a faust mesh and an smplx model in any 3D viewer of your choice. MeshLab is a free software for visualisation but you could use your own viewer if it's easier.

i have checked ,my orientation is same as faust mesh
[result_2.8.zip](https://github.com/ThibaultGROUEIX/3D-CODED/files/8022407/result_2.8.zip)
.
the result_2.8.zip  is the correspondence result.

Based on the shapes and poses I am seing for source and target, in my experience, 3D-CODED would definitely work. 
Please share a screenshot of your orientation check.
